extracted_information: Comprehensive technical specifications, key features, and performance improvements for the Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct model. The model is an instruction-tuned causal language model with significant advancements in structured output generation, long-context support, and multilingual capabilities. Specific memory requirements and detailed performance evaluations are referenced externally.

specifications.architecture: transformers with RoPE, SwiGLU, RMSNorm, Attention QKV bias and tied word embeddings

details: Improved generation of long texts (over 8K tokens)
Enhanced understanding of structured data (e.g., tables)
Improved generation of structured outputs (especially JSON)
More resilient to diversity of system prompts (enhancing role-play and condition-setting)
Long-context support up to 128K tokens (general Qwen2.5 series capability)
Multilingual support for over 29 languages (including Chinese, English, French, Spanish, Portuguese, German, Italian, Russian, Japanese, Korean, Vietnamese, Thai, Arabic)

features.details: Significant improvements in understanding structured data (e.g., tables) and generating structured outputs, especially JSON.
Specific GPU memory requirements and throughput details are referenced externally, not provided within the current content.
Enhanced knowledge base, improved capabilities in coding and mathematics, better instruction following, robust handling of system prompts, and broad multilingual support for text analysis.

references.title: Qwen2.5: A Party of Foundation Models

references.detail: @misc{qwen2.5, title = {Qwen2.5: A Party of Foundation Models}, url = {https://qwenlm.github.io/blog/qwen2.5/}, author = {Qwen Team}, month = {September}, year = {2024}}
